name: a(n) is the smallest prime p such that omega(p^n + 1) = n.
example: a(3) = 5 is the smallest prime of the set {p(i)} = {5, 11, 13, 19, 23, ...} where omega(p(i)^3 + 1) = 3.
mathematica: a[n_] := Module[{p = 2}, While[PrimeNu[p^n + 1] != n, p = NextPrime[p]]; p]; Print[Array[a, 11]]
program: (PARI) a(n) = forprime(p=2, oo, if(omega(p^n+1) == n, return(p)));
author: _Daniel Suteu_, Jan 06 2025
